title: Brewgrass festival promotes craft beer movement
title_page: Brewgrass festival promotes craft beer movement
maintext:
The Herald-Dispatch
HUNTINGTON — Brewgrass, Huntington’s first beer and bluegrass festival, took place Saturday at Taps at Heritage, which is located at the historical Heritage Station on 3rd Avenue.
The event featured over 50 craft beers, multiple bluegrass acts and numerous local vendors that offered food and merchandise.
Organizers said the mission of the event was to continue to promote the craft beer movement in the region by showcasing local bands and local retail and food vendors.
There were performances by Sour Mash String Band, Patrick Stanley, The Bing Brothers and Schultz Creek Bluegrass Band.
HIMG was the event sponsor, but other sponsors included Animal Care Clinic; Tyler Bullington with State Farm Insurance; Trainer, Wright and Paterno, CPAs and Consultants; Cabell Huntington Hospital; 97.9 The River; 92.7 The Planet; Main Street Insurance; St. Joe Men’s Group; Jeff Biederman, Ben McGinnis, Jim Karnes with Morgan Stanley; Riverside Insurance; Williams Faucette Advisor Group; Kurt B. Fleckenstein, DDS; Chad D. Barry L.C.; and Justice Glass & Supply Co.
